Package edu.cmu.cs.relab.tortoise

Provides classes for privacy risk calculator.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DataSource
    Provides a naive reader for CSV files to acquire privacy risk score data.
    PrivacyRiskCalculator
    Provides basic features for privacy risk calculators.
    PrivacyRiskCalculatorExample
    Provides a runtime example of the privacy risk calculator.
    PrivacyRiskEstimateCalculator
    Computes the privacy risk score based on a regression model with multiple parameters.
    PrivacyRiskMeanCalculator
    Computes the privacy risk score based on response averages.
    PrivacyRiskScore
    Describes a privacy risk score for a collection of information types.
    PrivacyRiskTarget
    Provides the information types and risk level for scoring.

Package edu.cmu.cs.relab.tortoise Description

Provides classes for privacy risk calculator. The privacy risk score is calculated using a PrivacyRiskCalculator class. To obtain a PrivacyRiskScore, one should pass as input a PrivacyRiskTarget object to the method PrivacyRiskCalculator#getMaxScore(PrivacyRiskTarget).

The PrivacyRiskTarget object is constructed from a risk level and one or more information types. The risk levels range from PrivacyRiskTarget#RISK_L1, which is the highest risk, to PrivacyRiskTarget#RISK_L5, which is the lowest risk. The default setting is RISK_L1, if the target object is constructed using the default constructor.

The risk level may be set using a constructor or by calling the method PrivacyRiskTarget#setLikelihood(String).

Information types have unique names that can be added using the method PrivacyRiskTarget#add(String). The target object may have more than one information type. To identify the list of supported information types for a privacy risk calculator, call the method PrivacyRiskCalculator#getSupportedTypes().

The calculated result is returned as a PrivacyRiskScore object that contains the score and a reference to the given PrivacyRiskTarget object.
